ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] jmxremote.password issues
ygData.msgSnippet: Java JMX insists the jmxremote.password file be only readable by the current (JVM launch) user, but the ways to set that up on Windows are beyond our script

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] jmxremote.password issues

Java JMX insists the jmxremote.password file be only readable by the 
current (JVM launch) user, but the ways to set that up on Windows are 
beyond our script automation.

This link...

http://web.archive.org/web/20070609091149/http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~schoefma/howto/run_heritrix_on_windows/

...(found via old thread 
<http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/3394>) may 
point you to a way to fix via Windows file properties dialogs.

While we try to keep Heritrix working on Windows, and in general it does 
because of Java's portability, only Linux/UNIX is officially supported 
(and gets full use/testing at the Internet Archive and other major 
user/sponsor organizations).

Still, we welcome suggested improvements to our launch scripts or 
documentation for the Windows cases. You can forward us suggestions, 
file JIRA issues, or make direct edits to the project wiki whenever you 
can share improvements of the existing guidance.

- Gordon

On 12/11/11 5:21 PM, finnsk3 wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> When I setup Heritrix we set the invironment variable JMX_OFF=yes because we could never get the jmxremote.password file to work. Now that we need to run multiple instances I need to get JMX working. If you look at the screenshot you will see jmxremote.password has the correct security settings but it still complains about having incorrect security.
>
> Screenshot: http://webarchive.linc.tas.gov.au/jmx.png
